alert.note: Alert for Allen (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 6:13PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EASTERN ALLEN COUNTY THROUGH 645 PM EDT... At 613 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cridersville, or over Fort Shawnee, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. This includes Interstate 75 between mile markers 119 and 141. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for west central Ohio.
